name: Ramamurthy (Ram) Charala
headline: Technical Product Owner / Business Analyst
tagline: Turning complex requirements into shipped outcomes across Retail, Public Sector, Travel, FMCG & Airline

experience.title: Technical Product Owner
highlights: Designed and implemented a journey management system replacing legacy POS across ~11,500 branches adhering to GDS standards.
Defined API requests/responses integrating POS devices, peripherals, payments and third‑party interfaces.
Set product vision/roadmap, MVP definition; drove discovery, backlog refinement, demos and KPI tracking (navigation & transaction time).
Delivered an AWS Operations Management Portal, eliminating manual processes and enabling secure device/user auth; built Datadog dashboards.
Managed non‑functional requirements (security, access, performance, alerting) and coordinated multi‑disciplinary deployments.

experience.title: Product Owner
highlights: Digitised critical operational processes within a Dynamics365 CRM transformation.
Automated logistics workflows, improving operational efficiency; documented As‑Is/To‑Be and service dependencies.
Defined Power BI dashboards for monitoring operational processes.

experience.title: Product Owner
highlights: Defined customer journeys, promotions, and payments; produced UX artifacts and BDD user stories.
Maintained product backlog, led refinement and sprint ceremonies with SMEs and engineering.

experience.title: Business Analyst
highlights: Requirements for a B2B SaaS check‑in app across 1,600 lounges / 600 airports, improving lounge transactions/sales by ~25%.
Specified APIs, device/peripheral integrations and non‑functional requirements; authored Gherkin/BDD stories.
Defined KPIs and Tableau dashboards; conducted gap/root‑cause analyses and supported testing/UAT.

experience.title: Business Analyst
highlights: Managed product roadmaps for flight‑attendant apps, mobile POS (iOS) and back‑office SaaS for airline clients.
Ran beta/pilot/MVP with iterative delivery; coordinated onsite/offshore teams and stakeholders.
Delivered Power BI dashboards; used SQL for data flows analysis.

experience.title: Business Analyst
experience.company: Marks and Spencer Plc (via TCS) – London
highlights: Delivered Mobile POS, Contactless PED rollout, Loyalty integration and Store POS transformation.
Defined use cases, activity diagrams; integrated payment and stock systems; CRM/Tax‑free promos.
Maintained RTM; conducted training for store and support teams.

experience.title: Business Analyst / Developer
experience.company: Marks and Spencer Plc (via TCS) – Chennai
highlights: Captured functional requirements for sales data migration (mainframe to DB2).
Developed mainframe applications; analysed HR interface design gaps.

use_cases.title: Nationwide POS Journey Management – Post Office
use_cases.context: Legacy POS replacement across ~11,500 branches under GDS standards.
use_cases.problem: Fragmented flows, high transaction time, complex device/peripheral integrations.
actions: Defined REST/JSON contracts, error taxonomies and versioning; introduced contract testing.
Drove roadmap/MVP, discovery to refine KPIs (nav time, transaction time).
Aligned multi‑vendor squads; planned phased deployments with DevOps.
use_cases.result: Reduced integration defects; accelerated releases; improved counter staff throughput and user experience.

use_cases.title: Ops Management Portal on AWS – Post Office
use_cases.context: Manual operational processes and disparate tools.
use_cases.problem: Operational inefficiency and poor visibility of device/user auth.
actions: Designed portal architecture; integrated secure authentication/authorization.
Built Datadog dashboards with real‑time metrics and alerts.
Delivered training and user guides for Ops/Support.
use_cases.result: Eliminated manual steps; ~200% efficiency improvement; faster incident response.

use_cases.title: B2B Lounge Check‑in SaaS – Collinson
use_cases.context: Global lounge operations needed a modern, scalable check‑in experience.
use_cases.problem: Legacy systems, limited data visibility, payment/peripheral complexity.
actions: Captured requirements and NFRs; defined API/Device/Payment integrations.
Authored BDD stories; defined KPIs and dashboards.
use_cases.result: ~25% uplift in lounge transactions/sales; improved CX and operational reporting.

use_cases.title: Mobile POS & Payments – M&S
use_cases.context: Multiple in‑store initiatives (Mobile POS, contactless PED, loyalty, transformation).
use_cases.problem: Complex in‑store flows and integrations across payments, stock and promotions.
actions: Gathered requirements; produced use cases/activity diagrams and RTMs.
Coordinated payment/stock/CRM integrations and stakeholder training.
use_cases.result: Successful rollouts; reduced checkout friction; consistent compliance and traceability.
